statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Ben Wallace dominated the boards and the Detroit Pistons got enough scoring from others to rally for a 75-72 win against the Miami Heat on Friday night.
article.headline: Wallace grabs 22 boards as encore to triple-double
article.linkText: Wallace's 22 rebounds help Pistons rally past Heat
article.story:
MIAMI (AP) -- Instead of another triple-double, Ben Wallace had to be satisfied with a season-high 22 rebounds.
Wallace

Wallace dominated the boards and the Detroit Pistons got enough scoring from others to rally for a 75-72 win against the Miami Heat on Friday night. Richard Hamilton scored 17 points, and Corliss Williamson hit a pair of key buckets down the stretch as the Pistons rallied to win for the fifth time in their last six games. "We struggled to put the ball in the basket tonight, but we found a way to win, and that's what it is all about,'' Pistons coach Rick Carlisle said. The Pistons beat the Heat for the second time in three nights, following up their 79-68 win on Wednesday in which Wallace recorded his second career triple-double with 19 rebounds, 12 points and 10 blocked shots. He didn't have to be as dominant on Friday, getting eight points and one blocked shot to go along with his 22 rebounds. "I just tried to stay active and put a body on somebody,'' Wallace said. "The ball seems to bounce my way sometimes -- 22 times tonight.'' The game was a defensive standoff, with neither team scoring consistently. Williamson put the Pistons ahead 73-72 on a short jumper with 1:02 left, and he followed that with another basket near the hoop for a 75-72 lead with 14 seconds to go. The Heat had a couple of late looks, but Eddie Jones missed a potential game-tying 3-pointer at the buzzer. After trailing 71-63 with three minutes left, the Pistons closed with a flurry. Wallace hit a jumper and Jon Barry hit a 3-pointer to close the gap to 71-69, and Hamilton tied it at 71 with a pair of free throws with 1:28 left. Despite not putting up huge numbers in scoring and blocked shots, Wallace helped the Pistons out with his rebounding. His jumper down the stretch also proved to be big. "What can you say?'' Carlisle said. "He hit the biggest shot of the game. That jumper really kept us in the flow. To put back-to-back games together like he did is amazing. I don't know if anyone has done that in a long time.'' Williamson and Barry, both playing off the bench, scored 14 and 12 points for Detroit. Miami has lost seven of its last eight overall and five straight at home. "This is tough,'' Heat center Brian Grant said. "We played too good not to win this game. It's like being in a fist fight and you have someone down and the match is over. You turn your head for one second and they catch you with an upper cut. We made mistakes -- a lot of them in the final two minutes.'' Jones scored 17 for Miami, and Grant added 16 to go along with 14 rebounds. Caron Butler added 14 points. The Heat shot just 3-of-16 in the fourth quarter and were outscored 25-16. "We just couldn't hold on,'' Miami coach Pat Riley said. "We played as hard as we could, but we couldn't make a shot at the end.''

Game notes
Heat starting forward Malik Allen suffered a bruised sternum in a fourth-quarter collision with Williamson and didn't return. ... Chucky Atkins started for the third time this season for the Pistons at point guard as Chauncey Billups sat out with a sprained ankle . ... C Zeljko Rebraca didn't start for the first time this year. ... The Pistons have held opponents under 80 points eight times this season. ... Barry hit a 30-footer at the first-quarter buzzer to pull the Pistons into a 20-20 tie. ... Butler leads all rookies in minutes played and is second in scoring at 12.4. ... Grant now has 51 career double-doubles, moving him to fourth on the Heat's all-time list.
